Title:
New species of Discosia rhododendronicola from Rhododendron
sp. and new geographical record of Diaporthe nobilis
Abstract:
In this study, we report a new asexual fungal species,
Discosia rhododendronicola (Discosiaceae) and a new geographical record
of Diaporthe nobilis (Diaporthaceae). Both species were isolated from
Rhododendron sp. in Kunming, Yunnan Province, China. Both taxa are
described based on morphology and DNA sequence data analyzed to infer
their phylogenetic relationships. A multigene phylogenetic analysis
based on LSU, ITS, RPB2, TEF1 and TUB2 sequence data indicate that
Discosia rhododendronicola is closely related to Discosia muscicola.
Diaporthe nobilis, reported herein as a new geographical record for
China and its phylogeny is depicted based on ITS, TEF1 and TUB2 sequence
data.
